gurmukhi: Dwie pry kr kop bfy Bt bwn kmwn kiRpwn sMBwry ]p`its loh hQI prsw kir kir kRoD chUM ids cauk pHwry ]
transliteration: Dhaae Dare Kar Kop Bade Bhat Baan Kamaan Kridaan Sanbhdare|| Pattis Loh Hathiparsaa Kar(i) Krodh Chahoon Dis Chaouk Prahdare||
translation: Holding their arrows, bows and swords the great warriors fell upon (the opponents); the warriors were striking blows from all the four directions, taking their swords, axes etc. in their hands;

gurmukhi: kuMjr puMj igry rx mUrDn soBq hY Aiq fIl iflwry ]rwvx rwm smY rx ko igrrwj mno hnvMq auKwry ]389]
transliteration: Kounjar Pounj Gire Ran Moonddhan Sobhat Hai At(i) Deel Dildare|| Raavan Raam Samai Ran Ko Gir-raaj Mano Hanvant Oukhdare||389||
translation: There were groups of elephants fallen in the war on the side and support of their faces and they appeared like the mountains uprooted and thrown by Hanuman in the Rama-Ravana war.389.

gurmukhi: caup crI cqurMg cmUM kruxwlX ky pr isMDu r pyly ]Dwie pry kir kop hTI kr kwit sBY pg d√çY n ipCyly ]
transliteration: Chaoup Charichaturan Chamoond Karounaalay Ke Par Sindhur Pele|| Dhaae Dare Kar(i) Kop Hathikar Kaattee Sabhai Pag Dvai Na Pichhele||
translation: Taking the fourfold army, the Lord (Kalki) was attacked through elephants through the persistent warriors were chopped, but still they did not retrace their steps;

gurmukhi: bwn kmwn kiRpwnn ky Gn sXwm Gny qn AwXuD Jyly ]sRon rMgy rmxIA rmwpiq Pwgn AMq bsMq sy Kyly ]390]
transliteration: Baan Kamaan Kridaanan Ke Ghan Syaam Ghane Tan Aayudh Jhele|| Sron Rane Ramneea Ramaapat(i) Phaagad Ant Basant Se Khele||390||
translation: Enduring the blows of bows, swords and other weapons and dyed with blood, the Lord (Kalki) looked like one who had played Holi in the spring season.390.

gurmukhi: Gwie sBY sih kY kmlwpiq kop BrXo kir AwXuD lIny ]du`jn sYn ibKY Dis kY iCn mY ibn pRwx sBY Air kIny ]
transliteration: Ghaae Sabhai Sah(i) Kai Kamlaapat(i) Kop Bdaryo Kar(i) Aayudh Leene|| Dujjan Sain Bikhai Dhas(i) Kai Chin Mai Bin Praan Sabhai Ar(i) Keene||
translation: When wounded, the Lord was greatly enraged and he took his weapons in his hands; he penetrated into the army of the enemy and killed all of it in an instant;

gurmukhi: tUt prY rmxI As BUKx bIr blI Aiq suMdr cIny ]XO aupmw aupjI mn mY rx BUm ko mwnhu BUKn dIny ]391]
transliteration: Toot Darai Ramnias Bhookhan Beer Baliat(i) Soundar Cheene|| Yaoun Oupmaa Oupjiman Mai Ran Bhoom Do Maanoh Bhookhan Deene||391||
translation: He fell upon the warriors and he seemed splendidly beautiful as if the had given the ornaments of wounds to all the warriors in the battlefield.391.

gurmukhi: caup ciVE kir kop klI kiRq AwXuD AMg Anykn swjy ]qwl miRdMg aupMg mucMg su BwNq Anyk BlI ibD bwjy ]
transliteration: Chaoup Chadio Kar(i) Kop Kalikrit Aayudh An Anekan Saaje|| Taal Mridan Oupan Mouchannd Su Bhant Anek Bhalibidh Baaje||
translation: The Lord Kalki, bedecked his limbs with weapons, and in great rage, went forward; many musical instruments including drums were played in the war-arena;

gurmukhi: pUir PtI Cuit DUr jtI dyv Adyv doaU auT Bwjy ]kop kCU kir kY icq mo klkI Avqwr jbY rx gwjy ]392]
transliteration: Poor Phatichhouttee Dhoor Jatijat Dev Adev Dooo Outh Bhaaje|| Kop Kachhodh Kar(i) Kai Chit Mo Kalkiavtaar Jahai Ran Gadje||392||
translation: Seeing that dreadful war, the matted locks of Shiva were also loosened and both the gods and demons fled away; all this happened at that time when Kalki thundered in rage in the battlefield.392.

gurmukhi: bwj hny gjrwj hny niRprwj hny rx BUm igrwey ]fol igirE igrmyr rswql dyv Adyv sBY Bhrwey ]
transliteration: Baaj Hane Gadraaj Hane Nripraaj Hane Ran Bhoom Giraae|| Dol Girio Girmer Rasaatal Dev Adev Sabhai Bhahraae||
translation: The horses, elephants, and kings were killed in the battlefield; the Sumeru mountain trembled and thrust into the earth; the gods and demons both became fearful;

gurmukhi: swqo aU isMD sukI srqw sB lok Alok sBY Qhrwey ]cauk cky diRgpwl sBY ikh pY klkI kr kop irswey ]393]
transliteration: Saato Sindh Soukisartaa Sabh Lok Alok Sabhai Thahraae|| Chaouk Chake Drigpaal Sabhai Kih Pai Kalki Kai Kop Risaae||393||
translation: All the seven oceans and all the rivers dried up in fear all the people trembled; the guardians of all the directions were wonder-struck as to who had been attacked in anger by Kalki.393.

gurmukhi: bwn kmwn sMBwr hTI hT TwT hTI rx koitk mwry ]jwNG khUM isr bwh khUM As ryx pRmwx sBY kir fwry ]
transliteration: Baan Kamaan Sanbhaar Hathihath Thaadh Hathiran Kotik Mdare|| Jaanh Kahoon Sir Baah Kahoon As Ren Pramaan Sabhai Kar(i) Ddare||
translation: Holding his bow and arrows, Kalki, killed crores of enemies; the legs, heads and swords lay scattered at several places; the Lord (Kalki) rolled all in the dust;

gurmukhi: bwj khUM gjrwj Dujw rQ auSt pry rx puSt ibdwry ]jwnuk bwg binE rix mMfl pyKn kau jit DUr pDwry ]394]
transliteration: Baaj Kahoon Gadraaj Dhujaa Rath Jsht Dare Ran Pousht Biddare|| Jaanouk Baag Banio Ran(i) Mandal Pekhan Kau Jattee Dhoor Padhdare||394||
translation: The elephants, horses, chariots and camels were lying dead; it seemed that the battlefield had become and arrows and Shiva was looking for it, roaming hither and thither.394.

gurmukhi: lwj Bry Airrwj chUM ids Bwj cly nhI Awn iGry ]gih bwn kiRpwn gdw brCI Ct CYl Cky icq cOp icry ]
transliteration: Laaj Bhare Ariraaj Chahoon Dis Bhaaj Chale Nahiaan Ghire|| Gadh Baan Kridaan Gadaa Barchhichhat Chhail Chhake Chit Chaoup Chire||
translation: The inimical kings, filled with shame ran in all the four directions and they again began to strike blows taking up their swords, maces, lances etc. with double zeal;

gurmukhi: piRqmwn sujwn Ajwn Bujw kir pYj pry nhI Pyir iPry ]rx mo mir kY js kO kir kY hir so lir kY Bv isMD qry ]395]
transliteration: Pritmaan Sujaanndajaan Bhooja Kar(i) Paij Dare Nahipher(i) Phire|| Ran Mo Mar(i) Kai Jas Kau Kar(i) Kai Har(i) So Lar(i) Kai Bhav Sindh Dare||395||
translation: He, whosoever came to fight with that most powerful Lord, did not return alive; he died while fighting with the Lord (Kalki) and earning approbation, ferried across the Ocean of fear.395.
